text:
This article is discussing the Estonian documentary film "Smoke Sauna Sisterhood" (桑拿私密语), directed by Anna Hints (安娜·亨兹). The film explores the tradition of smoke saunas in Estonia and how they have been passed down through generations. The film has received several awards and nominations, including Best Documentary at the 36th European Film Awards and the Audience Award at the 39th San Sebastián International Film Festival.

The article provides information about the film's release date, runtime, genre, language, and production team, as well as its reception on Douban, a Chinese social media platform. It also includes download links for the film in various resolutions and file sizes, as well as magnet links for BitTorrent downloading. Finally, the article promotes the public account "影的后花园" (Behind the Screen) on WeChat, encouraging readers to scan a QR code or search for the ID "BluFilm" to follow the account.
